alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 8:53PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: .The heavy rain has ended but runoff from the rainfall will continue this evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ashland and Iron Counties. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM CDT Saturday, runoff from heavy rain that fell earlier from slow moving thunderstorms continued. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Turtle Flambeau Flowage and Mercer. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Campers and hikers should avoid flooded trail crossings. If camping at a site along or near the banks of rivers or streams, move away from those locations and seek higher ground. Trails in hilly terrain can quickly become unstable during or shortly after heavy rainfall.
